thread.title: Man arrested for indecent exposure at Bartlett train station Elgin Courier-News
thread.title_full: Man arrested for indecent exposure at Bartlett train station - Elgin Courier-News

author: chicagotribune.com
title: Man arrested for indecent exposure at Bartlett train station Elgin Courier-News
text:
A Chicago man exposed himself in front of people at the Bartlett Metra station Sunday, according to Bartlett police.
Rick Paloncy, 63, of the 600 block of West Marquette Road in Chicago was arrested and charged with one misdemeanor count of public indecency, police said.
According to police, at approximately 10 a.m. officers were called to the Metra train station at 120 Railroad Ave. in Bartlett, for a report of an indecent exposure. Following an investigation, police arrested Paloncy for exposing himself in front of people while inside the Metra station.
Paloncy was released on bond and given a court date of Dec. 4 at 1:30 p.m., at the Rolling Meadows courthouse.
